Adventurous women, unite! This group is for ladies who want to spend more time outdoors in the company of other rad women, whether it's your first time crumpling newspaper into balls for tinder or your hundredth. In other words, all skill/experience levels are welcome.

We'll post here about our upcoming overnight adventures, plus day hikes and happy hours local to the Bay Area.
__

Trail Mavens empowers women to be the fire-starters, the tent-pitchers, and the map-readers, creating opportunities to adventure, leadership, and starry-night campfire conversation in the great outdoors.

name: Vision Leadership Development Meetup
description:
Business Owners who want to learn some tax strategies.
Individual whose looking for guidance in cash management, retirement plans, tax planning, increasing cash flow, college planning.
People who are pretty busy but still wants to make extra income on the side.
Stay at home moms or single moms who would like to be trained and mentored on how money works and how to take care of their finances.
Unemployed people who would like to be trained and mentored by a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) on taxes and financial services - and this can possibly be their new career. And develop their personality and leadership skills.
Employees who are complaining about paycheck to paycheck and paying too much taxes.

name: Women in Localization - Silicon Valley Chapter
description:
Women in Localization was founded in 2008 and is the leading professional organization for women in the localization industry. Its charter is to promote professional development, networking, and continuous education among its rapidly-growing global membership. Started in the San Francisco Bay Area, Women in Localization is currently expanding its membership to include women across the globe, encouraging members to meet in local geographies.

This group is for events organized by the Silicon Valley Chapter.

name: Women in  Blockchain
description:
Calling all blockchain enthusiasts, novices, and professionals, Women in Blockchain is for anyone interested in learning about new developments in the space and connecting with each other!

We're planning regular educational and fun events in the Bay Area and always looking for space, sponsors, and speakers! 

Follow us on Twitter and visit our website for regular updates.

name: Unwind! East Bay Women Entrepreneurs
description:
Come Unwind with us!

Unwind! East Bay Women Entrepreneurs is a space for women entrepreneurs and aspiring women entrepreneurs to network and support one another in a casual, fun, and welcoming atmosphere. 

Unwind is a place to come for connection and friendship. We are SO excited and happy to spread the word about your business and to support you! This happens organically in Unwind, so please plan to enjoy yourself, drink delicious wine, loosen up a bit and have fun! Please do not plan to give a sales pitch.

We meet once a month, usually on a Thursday evening from 6:30-8:30 PM, at various "wine-centric" spots around the East Bay (usually Oakland).

name: x
Women 2.0
description: This group is created for women, by women. We aim to empower ourselves to live healthier lifestyles physically, mentally, and emotionally. Together, we take our health to the next level, the 2.0 level! We love to let our hair down and have some fun while learning from each other's experiences.  We teach each other how to feel and function better, love ourselves more, and overall be a new and improved 2.0 version! Join us and share your incredible and inspirational gifts with our Women 2.0 community!

name: San Jose Woman's Club
description:
San Jose Woman's Club, serving women and the community since 1894, has an active calendar of events, provides scholarships for local students, funds local and women's charitable organizations, and performs charitable work. We have ten Activity Sections: Antiques , Be a Dear and Donate a Brassiere, Besse Book Group, Bridge, Companion Animal Welfare, Ladies Who Do Lunch, Mahjong, Needle Arts, Walking for Fun and Health, and Women in Leadership and Technology. We also have special events and fundraisers throughout the year. 

Come join us! Events and membership are open to all, not just women. Please note that joining the Meetup does not mean joining the San Jose Woman's Club. Membership only $60 per year, but it's not required to attend. If you are interested in joining San Jose Woman's Club as a member, visit our membership page for more details:  www.sjwomansclub.org/members.html.

name: Womens INner Strength : Lean In Group
description: Our mission is about empowering women to tap into their inner strength and derive the confidence to reach their highest potential. We strive to help female leaders, entrepreneurs, innovators and dreamers get that helping hand to make their visions real !!!

name: Give Glow - A community for women
description:
Learn more at Give Glow website

Give Glow is a community for women seeking to grow, lead and own their worth. 

A community for women who wants to find our gifts, wisdom, and worthiness. 

We come together to share our stories; share the gifts and beauty we see in one another. 

We come together to feel more connected, to one another and to the world.


We glow with confidence and light, when we recognize our our gifts, our voice.

We step into our leadership, when we know our power, our worth.

When we own our worth, we show up as the person we are meant to be.

When we own our worth, we give the world what it needs.

name: Bay Area How to Build a Business Training & Networking Group
description:
This group is dedicated to supporting our Bay Area community of entrepreneurs. This support includes both free education and networking - to elevate the knowledge and connectivity within our Bay Area Entrepreneur group.

Avi Gingold, Organizer

name: East Bay Business Women's Connection
description:
East Bay Business Women's Connection is a group designed to encourage business women to get to know each other on a deeper level and to create a strong foundation for networking, referral business, and professional development. This group is industry specific so please join us at our next meeting to secure your spot. Each meeting will have a speaker and a 10 minute member spotlight. Please bring your business cards and handouts to share. Lunch is not required but strongly recommended.  The food is good and reasonably priced :-)

It's more than just networking, it's making connections!

name: Bay Area 20Something Women in Engineering and Technology
description: This group is for 20Something women in engineering and technology looking to make connections both socially and professionally. Let's get together for brunch, happy hours, festivals, trivia nights, and any other fun activities that the group would like to do! Being a woman in a male-dominated field has its unique challenges, so lets get together and share stories and support for each other as we pursue our career goals, or leave the work at the office and just have fun!

name: Meeting of the Muses
description: Calling all Muses! Ready to join a network of women who are interested in supporting each other? Through book club, DIY, yoga, conferences - let's do all the fun stuff we want to do all while empowering each other and enriching our lives - together! Meeting of the Muses started out as a book club - but this will be a great central place to unite and empower over books, crafts, or being out in nature. <3

name: San Francisco Ladies  Meetup
description:
This is a group for all women looking to enjoy the company of other women and discuss lifestyle aspects such as love, relationships, and dating. It is a time for women to meet others and become empowered through these conversations on finding love and keeping love fresh and alive!

Our events will include Happy hours, professional workshops, and wine tastings. Anything that women feel looks fun and relaxing to enjoy a night out.

name: The F Word: mom's night out
description:
Are you exhausted? 
Do you juggle absolutely everything in your household -- all the way from your job to that one extra "big" kid (you know who I mean) in the house?
Do you go to the bathroom just to squeeze in some alone time and get a few Instagram minutes in peace?
Do you want to be the mom that cooks only organic, non-GMO, flourless, sugarless, non-allergenic, non-everything food but sometimes you've gotta just go to Safeway and grab that pizza? 

REJOICE! This group is just for you. And mothers like you everywhere.
Here's to the ones that take life seriously...but not too seriously. The ones who embrace The F Word(s) -- fun, family, fashion, friends, fitness, and feelings...even fermented fruit juice (ahem..wine).

Come cry with us. Come laugh with us! Come enjoy your night out, and celebrate The F Words of life.

name: Bay Area Professional Career Growth & Development Community
description:
A group dedicated to aiding in the career development of our members - 

i. Personal Branding, and your breakthrough formula:
Who You Are + What You Want = Why You Are Perfect For Promotion/Hire/Career/Step
Ii. Getting Promoted and Getting Raises.
Iii. Educational, Coaching regarding a personal corporate brand for you as a career professional
Iv. Networking to support professional development.

name: Walnut Creek women's fashion and style Meetup
description: This group is for anyone who is interested in bettering their self image. Women who want to enhance their overall image and personal brand so they can achieve higher self-confidence, experience personal power, and reach their personal and career dreams.

name: Placer Women's Network
description:
PWN Mission is to allow busy women professionals to develop professional relationships with other business professionals, create lead generation and exchange referrals in a social and supportive atmosphere.

We meet the 2nd Tuesday of each month at the Old Spaghetti Factory in Roseville from 11AM to 1PM. Please RSVP online at www.PlacerWomensNetwork.com

name: Young Fun and Professional (Sacramento)
description: This group is dedicated to professionals who like to get out and have some fun! We are young spirited, driven, and love to socialize. Some of the activities we will do are things like: Wine Tasting, Black Tie Networking Events, Pub Golf, VIP Nights, Bottle Service, River Floating, Skydiving, Beer Pong Tournaments, Snowboarding, Sunday Funday and Pool Parties. We may also do some professional development things such as goal setting events, creating dream boards, sales training, destination traveling and attending "Tony Robbins" style events.

name: Women Rise Up Santa Cruz
description:
Hello Gorgeous Women
Welcome to Women Rise Up!

Where you can give and receive support in a variety of ways. 
(This is a new group that is still evolving, be sure to attend so your voice and presence can be heard and felt)  

This is a place where you get to practice being authentic, true to yourself and present with yourself and your needs. A space where you get to exercise your receiving muscle and stand in your value. An opportunity where you can connect and network with big-hearted, passionate women who have big gifts, a large vision and a common intent to share an shine! 

AND, we as WOMEN, with big things to do in the world, THRIVE with support, boundaries, clear communication, awesome self-care, and an empowering practice that LOVINGLY supports the mind and body to be in alignment with our mission and vision without shaming, judging, and criticizing (which shuts us down and keeps us from forward motion).  

TOGETHER we are stronger!

Most importantly, as a women, we have feelings and emotions...and often our businesses become a place where our greatest healing takes place. 

How do we stay positive and make progress in our business when we are busy processing, feeling and healing?

How do we learn how to know what we want and ASK for it if we don't have a safe place to practice? 

Come be seen, heard and supported, and bring friends that you feel are in alignment to this group.

In gratitude and service, Carla

name: Livermore Business Intelligence Meetup
description: The "Livermore Mastermind Group" will be comprised of professional women that have started up a new business, has an established business or is contemplating starting a business. The purpose of the "Livermore Mastermind Group" is to raise the bar by challenging each other to create and implement goals, brainstorm ideas, and support each other with total honesty, respect and compassion.

name: Walnut Creek Girl's Night Out
description: Women who are 35-50, looking to form some great friendships. Happy hours, girl's night out, fitness, dancing, live music, concerts, dining, sporting events, great conversation, day trips, weekend trips, wine tasting, champagne tasting, hikes, networking, brunches...the list goes on.

name: Monterey Bay Women In Cannabis
description: A support group for women entrepreneurs in cannabis in Monterey and Santa Cruz Counties. We'll meet monthly at lunch or happy hour between Monterey and Santa Cruz. Our meetups are focused on sharing information and providing support for cannabis entrepreneurs. All are welcome to join! We only ask two questions: 1. How can you help? 2. What do you need help with?

name: Radiant & Rich Eco-art Hikes for Women: Amplify Your Impact
description: Dearest heart-centered creative woman, these outdoor adventures equip you to create the life of your heart's desire and increase your positive impact in the world. While each event centers on a specific theme, all are designed to rejuvenate your spirit, fill you with joy, ignite your imagination, and support you to define and live your life's purpose. In this group, you join a movement of soulful change-makers committed to transforming ourselves, our work, and our world in ways that ensure social justice and ecological thriving become the central drive of our culture.

name: UNA-SF Womens Committee
description: Welcome to all who are passionate about human rights issues. We will gather together each month to engage in interactive dialogue concerning the upcoming CEDAW women & human rights conference held annually in New York in March. How can we better engage our communities to rise up and eliminate all forms of violence against women and children worldwide?

name: San Francisco Entrepreneurs & Startups
description:
San Francisco Entrepreneurs & Startups (SFES) is dedicated to helping startup entrepreneurs participate in all kinds of entrepreneurship programs provided by startup incubators and investors.

We offer startup networking events, technical seminars, demo and pitch presentations, business workshops, entrepreneurship coaching and mentorship services.

Entrepreneurs, innovators, developers, executives, startup founders and business owners, join us if you want to get help with business basics, participate in networking activities and cofounder mixers, find marketing resources and strategic partners, seek investors and venture capital, get access to advisory boards and mentors, as well as improve entrepreneurship skills in various training programs.

name: Ladies Who Launch - Silicon Valley/San Jose, CA Area Group
description:
Ladies Who Launch is a women's social and business networking group with an open format and never, never any paid dues being pushed (for services few even want!). First and foremost, we are about building authentic relationships. Only then can we support one another and help each other in business. Let's talk, trade, collaborate, connect, chit chat, commiserate, and have some cocktails while doing it!

Ladies Who Launch:
-Is Inclusive and open-minded to different ideas (If it fits in, post about an event, and suggest or plan an event on my meetup page!).
-Never requires a paid membership (or even offers one for that matter!)
-Is about women in business, referrals, personal development, networking, and fun.
-May have speakers from time to time, may just be social. And everything in between is fine by me!
-Allows other people to schedule events and post, so any existing groups currently running meetings related or unrelated to Savvy are certainly welcome to stay.

Join our Linkedin Group https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13583345

name: Mountain View Cryptocurrency, Ecommerce, Speaking, Marketing
description:
If you have a business, product, service or message - this group is just what you need.
Entrepreneurs ready to do more in life and never feel left behind on the newest information in this digital age of ours.

We are a Meetup group devoted to helping you meet and network with some of the most connected people in the area and beyond.
We want you to learn how to find new clients, grow your business, create new opportunities and increase revenue in the world of the internet, cryptocurrency and more!

That is what the we are all about... the fun part of business. Let's make a difference in our business, meet our goals and learn new techniques that will truly change our world!

name: Davis Ladies Game Night
description:
Attention Lady Game-Players!

We're getting together to play games. Join us to play: board games, card games, short games, long games, games of all varieties. This group is for local ladies of all ages to hang out, use our brains, make new friends, strategize, problem-solve, laugh, and enjoy board games in a casual setting.  Please bring a new game to teach us or just bring yourself (there are usually plenty of games to choose from).  We hope to meet you at our next game event!  :)

name: She Inspires Women's Network
description:
Hello Ladies

My name is Cindy Lee.. I am the host of new meetup called "Exchange clothing and make friends"

We created the Meetup to bring ladies together and create the community that its member care, love and compassionate to each other by clothing exchange and gifting and inspire each other by doing good to the world.

We also want to raise the environmental issue and create the opportunity that we can help reduce the clothing waste and help our member to reuse what they have and save money. Sometimes We have entrepreneur guests who talk about their company and work to inspire our members.

We are located in San Francisco and we host an event once a month right now but eventually, we will host an event in South San Francisco with collaboration from other entrepreneurs.

If you are interested in being a member to our meetup this is the link...

https://www.meetup.com/San-Francisco-Exchange-clothing-and-make-friends-Meetup

and check out our next event.

Kind regards,

Cindy

name: Bay Area Filipino American Real Estate Retire in Style Group
description:
Building a community of Filipino-Americans, Americans and Expats who want to explore retirement living and investing in the Philippines as an option.

Learn the Pros and Cons to better retirement outside the US. Build a community of Baby Boomers of Filipinos, Americans, and Expats who will learn customs, traditions and points of interest by creating a mastermind and network with those who are living it. 

For the community: Mingle and exchange culture, basic practices, share food and travels, experience our kind Filipino hospitality and learn to create a good, healthy lifestyle prior to retirement.

Espie:

Organizer,
Excited to meet you!  See you soon!

name: San Jose Fashion Sellers
description: This meetup is dedicated to those who sell clothes, shoes, jewelry, and accessories or are in the fashion industry. We are a group of women who connect from all walks and all stages of life looking to find other people who are on the same or similar journey. Whether you're a boutique owner, have an online store, or are a fashion designer/stylist, this group is for women who are running their own business in the fashion world.

name: Fearless Female Founders
description:
Are you a Female Founder of a startup or company? Are you thinking about starting your own business? Have you experienced the roller-coaster ride of creating your own business? Needing the courage to make your vision a reality? Looking to connect with like-minded women in a nurturing and inspiring way? This group is for you!

Join us to make real connections with innovative, intelligent and inspiring women. We are a group of fearless female founders who are inspired to learn about ourselves, our businesses and create successful impactful businesses. We meet to exchange business ideas, our challenges, opportunities and how to strengthen our entrepreneurial mindset. This is your place to learn and share with like-minded women in a safe environment that nurtures innovation, curiosity, and exploration. Looking forward to meeting you and hearing your story!

name: SheLeadsHer - Millennial Women Leadership Network
description:
The State of Women in the United States are calling for the next generation of women leaders. Millennial Women, are you up for the challenge?!

LEAD-HER-SHIP: As all great leaders grow and develop, the first person they master is themselves. Leadership is understanding your foundation, understanding yourself, your desires and feeling confident on your path. SheLeadsHer is designed for millennial women to start or continue the process of self reflection, authenticity, and ambition as it relates to your career trajectory. While the state of women reflect less than 20% are in the C Suite and 46% of women are in entry level positions, SheLeadsHer is a network of millennial women who feel a strong desire to change these numbers, starting with herself. This group is private and exclusive for millennial women to network with one another, share best practices on reaching your full potential, finding friends to attend conferences with, voluteer work and many opportunuties to push the limits on developing courage to create change, within ourselves, as it relates to career and leadership. I look forward to meeting you!

Jaemi Serene
Women's Leadership Coach, Speaker & Blogger
www.facebook.com\jaemiserene
www.jaemiserene.com

name: Bay Area Business Women Collaborative Network
description:
Who we are: 
We are a FREE collaborative network of business professionals looking to uplift our brands and grow our businesses by making connections and building a referral system. 

We are more than just a Meetup group because we are always exploring ways to help you connect, promote and share your value with our network.

What we do: 
We host educational and networking events to enable our members to learn from each other, collaborate, create partnerships, generate leads and help our communities. 

We sincerely hope you'll attend one of our upcoming Meetup events. They are a great way to connect and network in a relaxed and easygoing atmosphere.

We look forward to learning more about your business and hope to see you at our next event.

Aida Jones, Organizer


Serving the following cities: San Jose, Campbell, Los Altos, Saratoga, Santa Clara, Sunnyvale, Cupertino, Mountain View and more.

name: Rock My Finances
description: 3 Secrets of the language of love and money

name: Young and Passionate in Palo Alto
description: Are you passionate about business, productivity, and networking? Come meet like-minded professionals in the heart of Silicon Valley. This group consists of fun, catered events geared towards young entrepreneurs. Join now to be notified of our first "Mansion Meetup Event"!

name: The San Francisco LGBT Professionals
description:
There is a need for events with pre-screened professionals, in settings that facilitate social interaction, and provide entertainment in an organized manner in the San Francisco Bay Area.  

As professionals we recognize the value of these events, and the costs involved.  Therefore this is a PAID group, of $5 per month, which we encourage to be paid quarterly ($15), or yearly ($45).  This does NOT cover our costs, but helps pay fees to MeetUp and weeds out people who join many groups, but never participate. 

Dues can be paid via Meetup (WePay) or in person with cash or credit card (Square). 

We do require members (1) give their real name (at least first name), (2) an appropriate picture of themselves in their profile (suitable for recognizing you at events), (3) regularly attend events and be involved with the group, (4) pay dues.

Events are organized based on member interest and feedback.  Please be sure to fill out the Poll Questions to participate.

We ask you pay for guests you bring to events (fees will be posted).

Please wait for your approval before attending an event, or contact the organizer for an exception.

name: Lesbian Professional Social Group
description:
LPSG is geared towards female identified people in the LGBTQ community.

We host a variety of social events including mixers, dinners, and other fun times!

We hope that this allows for human connections, and professional networking.

Join us!!

name: QueerFest Sacramento
description:
Welcome to QueerFest Sacramento!!! 

We typically have two or more 'official meetups' a month, but check the Discussions section for personal invitations (movies, dancing, hiking, etc) and our calendar for community events at-large.

Let me know what type of events and venues interest you, and which night of the week works best for you. 

To host quality events we need your support! For a little over a penny a day you have exclusive access to unique events, discussion boards and a community calendar. An annual $5.00 community contribution is required within the first 90 days of membership. Members can pay online or send me an email if you prefer to pay in person. 

In addition, new members must attend a meetup within the first 90 days. 

We believe a large part of our success is due to not allowing anonymous, non-participatory membership. When you join this group, you actually MEET women doing fun, diverse activities during the entire course of your membership. If you're looking to engage with other lesbians in 'real time' then this is the group for you! 

Please review the Group Guidelines thread on the Message Board for additional information.

Hope to see you soon,

name: Bay Area Lesbian Professionals
description:
This is a group for Bay Area professional lesbians and their friends. It's one part fun get togethers, one part networking (which can be fun too) and one part whatever we make of it together.

You can follow on twitter here: https://twitter.com/LesProfessional

name: Rainbow Community Center Women's Calendar
description:
The Rainbow Community Center (RCC) of Contra Costa County has served the LGBTQ community since 1992. This Meetup group is for women interested in the activities at the RCC. All women's activities will be posted on the calendar and members will be able to see all the activities and talk with each other about them.         


The Rainbow Community Center of Contra Costa County envisions a society that embraces acceptance, safety and equality for all, regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.

Our goal is to provide a safe, supportive and respectful environment for LGBTQ people of all ages, socio-economic status, races, cultures and religions.  We strive to create services and activities that will promote the mental, physical and spiritual well-being of our community by providing professional services, peer support, referral services, social opportunities and educational programs of interest to our community as well as to the community at large.

name: Femmes & Friends of SF Bay
description: Femmes & Friends strive to celebrate the diversity of the lesbian community. We are group of friends interested in meeting other professional lesbians between the ages of 35 and up. Our gatherings will be aimed at inspiring and enriching the lives of lesbians in the San Fransico bay area. A place were accomplished women can come together to socialize and network for both personal and professional enhancement.

name: Lesbian Summer Camp
description: These camps were created for lesbians to come together and play for an entire weekend. We have tons of fun hiking, swimming, boating, camping and meeting new friends. There are women that come from as far South as San Diego and as far North as Oregon. We have had women fly in from New York, Montana and Chicago to just us for the weekend. Women arrive with a friend, in a group and many fly solo. Some of us know each other, others do not know anyone. Every woman will feel included and welcome upon arrival. Prior registration is required. These camps have sold out every year.

name: East Bay lesbian friendly activity group over 40
description:
This group is for the lesbian-friendly community interested in group social activities such as bike riding, dinner events, dog walks, movie matinees, film nights, dances, hikes, etc.

This group is not sponsored. The organizers donate their time.

name: Lesbian Mixers & Minglers in the Mid-Peninsula & San Jose
description: This is a group for anyone interested in meeting other lesbian, bisexual and queer women in the mid-peninsula and San Jose area. Looking forward to meeting everyone!!!

name: (LAFS) Lesbians After Fifty & Single
description:
We are a warm and welcoming group that gets together for local activities. Events may include going to concerts, movies, art openings, discussion groups, walks with and without dogs, game nights, singing, hiking, doing crafts or artwork together, potluck gatherings, and whatever else strikes our fancy! 

A donation is requested to reimburse the organizer for monthly Meetup administrative fees.

name: CENTRAL VALLEY LESBIANS
description: This group is for lesbians 35 and up interested in meeting other lesbians for lunch, movies and events in the community!

name: LezCruz-Lesbian Social Meetup in Santa Cruz/Monterey County
description: We are a social community for lesbians who live and work in Santa Cruz and Monterey county areas. Everyone is welcome! You can also find us at http://lezcruz.org, https://www.facebook.com/groups/lezcruz/, and https://groups.yahoo.com/group/LezCruz/. LezCruz is an affiliate of the Diversity Center of Santa Cruz.

name: LesBiFit 24 OAKLAND
description: A group for LGBTQ Women, interested in living a healthy, active lifestyle.

name: San Francisco Lesbian Happy Hour
description: Come to a Lesbian Happy Hour to meet new, friendly women! This event will occur at a pre-determined location that serves alcoholic and non libations, and possibly food. Come meet women who are there to meet other women in a laid-back, casual, no-pressure atmosphere! This is perfect for those new to town or simply lesbians looking to meet like-minded women in an environment that caters towards conversation and socializing. Most events will occur on Friday evenings from 6-8pm with the ability to stay after if desired. This event is great for those wishing to meet others but who aren't into the late night/clubbing scene!

name: Creative Genius SF: Women Changemakers
description:
Creative Genius unites brilliant women change makers from around the San Francisco Bay Area. Creative Genius events provide movement, self-development, transformation, breakthroughs, an experience for your senses, community, nourishment for the soul, and new friendships!

This is a place to re-ignite your wildness, creativity, and your deep heart wisdom. A place for you to reconnect to yourSelf because maybe the path of "success" has trapped you in a box that drains your spirit. You know you are here for a greater purpose and want to stay creative, impactful, and connected! You want to be a change maker but the world or your work life has begun to beat the creativity out of you.. 

This is a place for your voice to be heard, seen, celebrated, relax, play, and ignite your strengths & gifts that the world desperately needs from you. This is a safe place for women change makers to unlock their greatness! A place to activate her genius, uplift her mood, and energy so she can be the most brave, beautiful, badass leader of her life! 

We welcome all women of all color, race, background, sexual orientation, spiritual practice, experience, and our trans sisters to come play at our Creative Genius playground every last Thursday of the month!

name: Modesto Queer & Lesbian Women's Social Group
description: This is a group for Modesto-area lesbian/queer/gay/bi women in their 20's and 30's. Let's eat good food, listen to rad music, play fun games, and build community outside of the bars (okay, in the bars sometimes too) :D.

name: San Francisco Dapper Dykes
description: A meetup for masculine-dressing lesbians to don their dapper duds and mingle over classic cocktails! Let's talk labels, tailoring, and the very real struggle that comes with being the dapperest dressers in a town full of hoodies and mandals. An inclusive Meetup for the whole spectrum: Butch/Stud, FTM, GenderQueer and the ladies who love us!

name: Lesbian Businesswomen (LBW)
description: The purpose of this group is to promote and support lesbian owned businesses within the community. Lesbian Businesswomen would like to reach out to anyone looking to either support or be supported. We will be hosting recurring events where women can showcase their businesses and network among each other. These events will be an amazing foundation to create new connections and to reach out to lesbians in our community. We are excited and hope you will get involved with this amazing group of women!

name: Half Moon Bay Lesbian Meetup
description: Meetup for drinks, dinner, shows, hikes, or the like.

name: Mandarin Women's LGBTQ Group
description: This a Mandarin conversational and social group for Lesbians, Gay, Bi, Trans, Queer and Questioning group. Meetings and gatherings will be in Mandarin, will mostly meet at coffee shops or restaurants, will have activities, hikes, movies, picnics, and other events if there is demand and help. This group will be keep anonymity allowing those who are not out some confidentiality. We will also try to do some volunteering and dedicate some time to social causes.

name: Lez-Be Handy-Girlz Meetup
description:
Some lesbians know how to fix things; some lesbians do not. And some lesbians who like to fix things like to be around women who like to learn how to fix things. So this group is for lesbians who either need help or want to help.

If you want help painting a room in your house or moving some furniture or changing your oil, schedule a meet up at your house and see who comes to help. And here's who you can expect to show up: members of this group who are lesbians and have posted their photos, names, and introductions. And after the job is done, it just might be time for dinner and drinks!

For the sake of safety, you may want to meet up somewhere safe to plan your work day. This can give you the opportunity to screen your help as well as provide your address privately, if you so choose. 

Another option is to meet at the location where you are purchasing an item that you need help hauling upstairs. Or you may want to put a call out for a lesbian with a truck who would be willing to help make a local delivery.

What's most important in this community is trust and gratitude. If you are receiving help from a woman from the good of her heart, give thanks and consider how you can help her out in return. And remember, physical and emotional safety is first and foremost. After that - it's all good.

name: Social Encounters for Lesbians near Sebastopol
description:
Social Encounters is for coupled and single lesbians who are interested in creating new friendships and having fun more often. Some events will be impromptu and others planned ahead. Let's create more experiences with others while we expand our social circles and enhance the quality of our lives. Professional, kind and respectful would describe a few qualities of this diverse and inclusive group of lesbians.. So, JOIN in, get out of the house, have fun and bring your smile.

" there's a difference between enjoying something and something making you happy", so let's find the rainbow together

For new members interested in joining, I appreciate the pictures of your loving pets although we ask you to include a photo of YOUrself so we know who you are. Thank you in advance for understanding.

name: deleted
description: Meet new people while partaking in fun adventures and activities!

name: El Dorado Hills Lesbian Meetup
description: Lesbians or Bi-sexual women looking for fun activities, deep and meaningful conversations, and a healthy life style. 40 years old or more is preferred but we will be inclusive of all who share our values :-)

name: FolsomLesbians
description: A place to meet new friends, Hang out and have fun.

name: Literary Lesbians: Bay Area Edition
description: A gathering for queer women interested in literary/art events, reading in cafes, perhaps some random beach/water/woodland adventures and of course the occasional potluck.

name: Aware + Well : A Retreat With Intersectionality
description: Circle up and discuss storytelling, and race & cultural conflict with a Black, Gay Woman from the South. Writer, conflict professional, and retreat leader, Lacey Wilson, invites you to take a deeper look at what we think we know regarding race and culture and in what ways can we expand ourselves to connect on a personal level, beyond the surface.

name: South Bay Girlfriends Meet!
description: This group is for women & open to the lgbtq community who are looking to make great lasting friendships based on the concept that it takes quality time to build quality friendships! I started this group because as a Bay Area newbie, I see the importance of having a strong network of girlfriends to experience all of life's triumphs and woes with. It's about celebrating friendship, ambition, womanhood and adventure! I really look forward to building great bonds with you all!

name: Wanderful Women Who Travel: San Francisco Chapter
description: We are jetsetters, expats, and young (and young at heart), professional, globally minded women. We believe in getting involved in the world around us, whether through travel, volunteering, or global awareness -- and we believe in the power of an internationally connected community to do it! Come join us for lectures, workshops, dinners out, and other things for women globetrotters. Brought to you by Wanderful, www.sheswanderful.com.

name: Silicon Bonding, A Social Group for Entrepreneurs (20s, 30s)
description: There are tons of entrepreneur groups that organize events specific to starting and running a business. This is not one of them. While this is a group for people 20-30-ish years old who operate their own businesses, the events themselves are just fun activities to facilitate networking. Get together and share some good food, some laughs, some war stories, and make new friends.

name: Fun Networking for HR & Young Professionals in SF
description: We are a group of performers that love throwing fun, unconventional meetups in SF. No weirdos shoving business cards in your face here. Our meetups focus on fun activities that actually let you interact with and get to know cool, new people. Introverts welcome! It's a VIP experience, but we keep the vast majority of meetups free to attend, with drinks, etc. optional. Important: to keep the quality of our events high we limit the number of people who can attend. If you are interested in coming to our fun, social meetups in SF then we recommend you joining now to save your spot. Highly recommended for HR Managers, other Human Resource folk and Young Professionals. More info about us at museumhack.com

name: Bay Area 20Something Women in Engineering and Technology
description: This group is for 20Something women in engineering and technology looking to make connections both socially and professionally. Let's get together for brunch, happy hours, festivals, trivia nights, and any other fun activities that the group would like to do! Being a woman in a male-dominated field has its unique challenges, so lets get together and share stories and support for each other as we pursue our career goals, or leave the work at the office and just have fun!

name: Women Founders & Entrepreneurs, ZimTalks, NorCal
description: At Parazim, our mission is to elevate and champion the most effective, extraordinary, and powerful women in the world. Our breakthrough habitude of "women helping women" leads to invaluable resource sharing and building strong allies so every female is 100% empowered to reach her highest potential. One way we work to close the gender gap in entrepreneurship and investing is by producing ZimTalks seminars where women gain the valuable opportunity to connect, learn, and grow with likeminded entrepreneurs. We provide legal information and "call-to-action" activities. For more info. and a full list of topics, visit www.parazim.com/zimtalks today!

name: Starting Over Now - A Women's Group
description: In these turbulent times many women find themselves in a place of having to start over for various reasons: after marriages or relationships have broken up, children have left the home, illness or distress has changed their life. All these issues can create huge emotional, spiritual, and physical pain in your life. This group will help you find not only new people that have endured your situation but a place to be safe and find some ideas on how to adapt. Change is hard but it is in the difficulties that we find our true spirit. Join this group that meets the first Friday of the month.

name: Mt. Diablo Business Women
description:
Mt. Diablo Business Women is a group of professional business women working in many industries including: banking, finance, interior design,technology, medicine, mental health, fashion, coaching, public relations real estate, skin and body care, website design to name a few. Members consist of both self-employed and corporate businesswomen. We have no limitation to industry or size of the business. We meet the second Wednesday of every month for either lunch or dinner, networking, and a speaker. Our meetings are an opportunity to network and to hear a speaker on business and personal development topics. We warmly welcome business women to our meetings and look forward to meeting you. To register, go to: 

http://www.mtdiablobusinesswomen.org/

name: Brilliant Business Women ~ East Bay SF, CA
description: Brilliant Business Women (BBW) is a group designed to encourage business women to get to know each other on a deeper level to create a strong foundation for networking, referral business and professional development in efforts to support each other.

name: Women's Connection Circle -Livermore - Share-Care-Grow
description:
Stay tuned!

A circle for women to SHARE herself (be seen) in a safe container, CARE (support other women) and 

GROW herself to be the best person she can be.

name: Women in Localization - Silicon Valley Chapter
description:
Women in Localization was founded in 2008 and is the leading professional organization for women in the localization industry. Its charter is to promote professional development, networking, and continuous education among its rapidly-growing global membership. Started in the San Francisco Bay Area, Women in Localization is currently expanding its membership to include women across the globe, encouraging members to meet in local geographies.

This group is for events organized by the Silicon Valley Chapter.

name: Mt. Diablo Business Women
description:
Mt. Diablo Business Women is a group of professional business women working in many industries including: banking, finance, interior design,technology, medicine, mental health, fashion, coaching, public relations real estate, skin and body care, website design to name a few. Members consist of both self-employed and corporate businesswomen. We have no limitation to industry or size of the business. We meet the second Wednesday of every month for either lunch or dinner, networking, and a speaker. Our meetings are an opportunity to network and to hear a speaker on business and personal development topics. We warmly welcome business women to our meetings and look forward to meeting you. To register, go to: 

http://www.mtdiablobusinesswomen.org/

name: Placer Women's Network
description:
PWN Mission is to allow busy women professionals to develop professional relationships with other business professionals, create lead generation and exchange referrals in a social and supportive atmosphere.

We meet the 2nd Tuesday of each month at the Old Spaghetti Factory in Roseville from 11AM to 1PM. Please RSVP online at www.PlacerWomensNetwork.com

name: Bay Area Business Women Collaborative Network
description:
Who we are: 
We are a FREE collaborative network of business professionals looking to uplift our brands and grow our businesses by making connections and building a referral system. 

We are more than just a Meetup group because we are always exploring ways to help you connect, promote and share your value with our network.

What we do: 
We host educational and networking events to enable our members to learn from each other, collaborate, create partnerships, generate leads and help our communities. 

We sincerely hope you'll attend one of our upcoming Meetup events. They are a great way to connect and network in a relaxed and easygoing atmosphere.

We look forward to learning more about your business and hope to see you at our next event.

Aida Jones, Organizer


Serving the following cities: San Jose, Campbell, Los Altos, Saratoga, Santa Clara, Sunnyvale, Cupertino, Mountain View and more.

name: East Bay Area Business Women Collaborative Network
description:
Who we are: 
We are a FREE collaborative network of business professionals looking to uplift our brands and grow our businesses by making connections and building a referral system. 

We are more than just a Meetup group because we are always exploring ways to help you connect, promote and share your value with our network.

What we do: 
We host educational and networking events to enable our members to learn from each other, collaborate, create partnerships, generate leads and help our communities. 

We sincerely hope you'll attend one of our upcoming Meetup events. They are a great way to connect and network in a relaxed and easygoing atmosphere.

We look forward to learning more about your business and hope to see you at our next event.

Aida Jones, Organizer

Serving the following cities: San Francisco, Emeryville, Oakland, Piedmont, Berkeley, El Cerrito, Albany, Kensington, Walnut Creek, Lafayette, Moraga, Orinda and more.

name: Bay Area Business Collaborative Network
description:
Who we are: 
We are a FREE collaborative network of business professionals looking to uplift our brands and grow our businesses by making connections and building a referral system. 

We are more than just a Meetup group because we are always exploring ways to help you connect, promote and share your value with our network.

What we do:
We host educational and networking events to enable our members to learn from each other, collaborate, create partnerships, generate leads and help our communities. 

We sincerely hope you'll attend one of our upcoming Meetup events. They are a great way to connect and network in a relaxed and easygoing atmosphere.

We look forward to learning more about your business and hope to see you at our next event.

Aida Jones,
Organizer

Serving the following cities: San Francisco, Emeryville, Oakland, Piedmont, Berkeley, El Cerrito, Albany, Kensington, Walnut Creek, Lafayette, Moraga, Orinda and more.

name: Confidence for Women Entrepreneurs Community
description:
Are you a woman entrepreneur who knows there is much more to your life than you have been living? Do you dream of making a big impact with your business, but you hold yourself back due to fears and lack of confidence? Do you know you were put on this planet for so much more than you are currently living? You are NOT alone! This group is for women entrepreneurs who have a big calling and are ready to step up and into that calling, to bust through those fears, build your confidence, and thrive. The world needs you and your message, so come be supported, empowered, and let your light shine like the brilliant woman you are. The more confidence you have, the bigger impact you can make, in the world and your bank account.

Watch this video on how Confidence and your income are directly related... https://youtu.be/-vz7J1r41CU

This group is a community. A community of women who are building their confidence, supporting one another in their goals, dreams and aspirations. Come each month as we build relationships with one another, learn how to break through blocks, and transform from caterpillars into beautiful butterflies, so that we can all make a much bigger impact in the world, together.

Join the Confident Woman Community on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/groups/confidencewomenentrepreneurs

I look forward to connecting with you!

With Purpose and Passion,

Erin Summ

www.erinsumm.com

Grab the FREE Report, 7 Secrets to Lasting Confidence for More Clients and Money in the Bank here... www.erinsumm.com/7Secrets

Join the FREE Stand Up and SHINE Confidence Challenge on Facebook here... https://www.facebook.com/groups/shineconfidencechallenge

Get the Stand Up and SHINE 60-Day Confidence Discovery Journal here... bit.ly/standandshine

name: Silicon Valley WITI Meetup Group
description:
The WITI Silicon Valley meetup group is for professional women who consider technology central to their businesses, careers and professions. WITI Networks provide amazing connections, resources and opportunities - all in a supportive environment that includes men who champion WITI's mission.

WITI's mission is to empower women worldwide to achieve unimagined possibilities and transformations through technology, leadership and economic prosperity.

WITI is the premier global organization helping tech-savvy women attain their professional goals. With a global network of smart, talented women & a market reach exceeding 2 million, WITI has established powerful strategic alliances and programs to provide connections, resources, & opportunities within a supportive environment of women committed to helping each other. WITI's mission is to empower women worldwide to achieve unimagined possibilities and transformations through technology, leadership and economic prosperity.

name: Women's Networking Alliance Chapter 112
description: We are a networking organizarion for Women Business Owners. Women's Networking Alliance provides a supportive environment which is fun, inspiring, and enables the growth of our members as professional business owners.

name: WINGS-CA (Women's International Network Giving Support)
description: Female professionals helping women and children in need. Women business owners and entrepreneurs helping other women succeed. WINGS is a philanthropic organization of entrepreneurial women locally and abroad that build trusted partnerships and promote each others businesses while conducting charitable activities. Meet like-minded women professionals and create a positive dynamic team within a nurturing group for business and personal growth. Inspire women to build business solid foundation, develop alliances, enhance leadership skills, and expand networks of women entrepreneurs and professionals locally and abroad. Establish and leverage trusted business relationships for the growth of each other's businesses. Inspire and mentor aspiring women entrepreneurs and professionals to thrive financially, emotionally and socially within the community and their chosen careers.

name: Team Women Capitola Business Women Networking Meetup
description: Team Women Capitola is a group of quality business minded women looking to support each other in building and growing successful businesses in our community.

name: American Singles Who Love Asian
description:
A unique group for Asian and Non-Asian who are interested in meeting each other. This group will support many Non-Asian who have lived in Asia, speak Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese or have a deep interest and connection with Asian culture. And it will support the many Asian in the area who would like to meet Non-Asian with an honest interest in and knowledge of Asian culture. Due to the increasing number of American who have lived in Asia or like Asian culture and the increasing number of Asian who are now living in the US, a mutual interest in Asian/American love relationships is also growing. These men and women consider themselves bi-cultural and are seeking a partner who can share and understand their bi-cultural values, interests and experiences. This will be a fun and exciting group unlike anything ever held in this area for Asian and American with mutual cultural experience and interests.

We look forward to seeing you!

name: SF Bay Area Transition Network: Embracing Change After 50
description:
SF Bay Area Chapter of The Transition Network. We are an inclusive community of professional women, 50 and forward, whose changing life situations lead them to seek new connections, resources, and opportunities. Our members are living the trends that affect today's women over 50 and defining new paths for this stage of their life. We get together through programs, events and small group interactions to inspire and support each other, make new friends and explore what's next.

For more information about The Transition Network and the Bay Area Chapter, visit www.thetransitionnetwork.org.

name: Silicon Valley Women's Career Life Enhancement
description: This meetup is for female professionals in high-tech, finance, healthcare, business etc. to learn from each other to boost career, make right choice in career change, reduce stress, build a happy family life, create an independent/professional/stylish image.

name: Crypto Palace Events
description:
All Blockchain, all the time.

Plus music, dancing, modeling, photography, kiteboarding, etc.

name: Grow Asia Meetup
description: A place to explore the opportunities and challenges of launching business operations and expanding in key regions in Asia, including China.

name: Asian Business Network and Outreach
description: Tired of not getting anywhere in your career? Want to give back to the community? We have the answer for you! We have networking events, resume and interview workshops! We also will have speakers that will come out educate and motivate you to achieve to your next level in your career! Outreach volunteer opportunities to help build your resume or just to give back will be available too! If you are interested come check us out!

name: Bay Area Nerd Girls
description:
This is a meetup for nerdy women and nonbinary folx to geek out, have fun, and support one another!

It should go without saying, but since it doesn't yet: we enthusiastically welcome transgender women. We also enthusiastically welcome nonbinary folx whose experience with gender has included being treated as a woman, whether or not they identify that way, to ensure a baseline experience with and empathy for the way those perceived as women are othered in nerdy circles.

BANG is a diverse group, and members tend to have an interest in any of the following:

    Comics  | Graphic Novels

    Gaming | Tabletop Roleplaying Games, Boardgames, Video Games

    Anime   | Manga

    Sci-Fi     | Fantasy

    Cosplay  | Dressing up

    No match up top? How about these:

    Baking, Knitting, Writing, Karaoke, crafty DIY ladies, Makeup, Graphic Design, Web Development, Interior Design, Science and Engineering, Cartoons, Activism/Hacktivism, Geek Feminism.

________________________________________________________________________________

Due to cis boys and solicitors joining the group, it is now private and memberships will now have to be approved. Don't worry! As long as you're a real person and write a few of your nerdy interests in your profile, you'll be fine for approval.

~April & the organizing team

|Links|

Info about the group can be found here: http://whatis.bayareanerdgirls.com/

Official Facebook Page

BANG Facebook forum (Approved BANG members only)

name: Women in Tech - SF Bay Area
description:
A community of women in technology where we talk tech in a non-judgemental friendly environment.

Goals: A monthly happy hours where we will talk about a pre-decided topic based on group suggestions. Eg: technology(Hadoop, Ruby-On-Rails etc.), latest start-up trends, use of latest technology in our daily lives etc..

Please don't feel you have to be an expert on that topic or for that matter know anything about it. If you are just interested in knowing more about it this is the place for you. We are all Super Women in our fields and it would be interesting to know about other things, as simple as that.

If you are working a project and would need help in technology or other aspects of project development you can ask for advice and get feedback from members of our group. We can have special meetups for those kind of activities.

If tech is what interests you come join our tech camaraderie.

DISCLAIMER:

The organizer reserves the right to say No. This group assumes ABSOLUTELY NO responsibility, including but not limited to injury or loss of any kind/form due to the use of information, or participating in activities found on this group/site. The organizer assumes no responsibility for any damage/loss of any kind/form related directly/indirectly to any kind of information found on this meetup group.

name: Sac Feminists
description:
Feminists come here to connect, find safe space, educate themselves, and educate each other on feminist issues.

We put on unique events for members of Sac Feminists, and we also cross-post events from other local progressive organizations so that members can see a lot of opportunities to get involved and connect.

If you have an idea for a meetup, get in touch with the organizers.

(In order to be approved as a member, you must answer the profile questions and have a picture of your face in your profile.)

name: The Humanist Connection: Serving Silicon Valley
description: The Humanist Connection seeks to build, educate, and nurture a diverse community of Atheists, Humanists, Agnostics in Silicon Valley. We accomplish this by hosting a variety of events, including public lectures from luminaries such as Richard Dawkins (Oct. '12, '13), day trips such as our excursion to the San Francisco Film Festival ('12, '13), pub nights, barbecues, dinners, art gallery visits, discussion meetings, and tailgate parties. If you're a non-believer, an agnostic, or even a doubting religious person, and you're looking for intellectual stimulation, come join our bright, vibrant group in Silicon Valley. Check out facebook.com/humanistconnection for more info.

name: Oakland Social Justice Books and Beer
description: This is a group for anyone interested in building community while reading awesome books. We'll primarily be reading books with social justice themes, or books by authors who often get left out of mainstream book clubs. I started the group because I'm new to the Bay and want to meet other folks interested in building community through intentional dialogue. Beer, wine, or the beloved mimosa will always be an option at meet ups. Book club meetings will happen once a month, but once we get started, other fun non-book related events throughout the month are always welcome! People of any & all identities welcome. Only read part of the book? Come anyways and participate in the discussion, we all have something to say about the subjects!

name: East Bay Feminist Book Club
description:
The East Bay Feminist Book Club is a social group open to all people who want to expand their knowledge about feminism and women's rights issues. We will read from a variety of feminist camps and persectives, including 2nd wave, 3rd wave, Black feminism, lesbian feminism, trans* perspectives, riot grrrl movement, third world feminism, etc. We'll also read things that aren't directly about feminism, but are interesting to read and discuss from a feminist lens. 

Our meetings are a space for open and respectful discussions of different viewpoints. Sometimes discussions stay strictly on the texts; other times, readings lend themselves to more personal discussions. Please check out our Discussion-Guideline-in-progress before attending meetings, and feel free offer suggestions and critiques. 

On readings: we tend to alternate between shorter readings (articles, short stories, essays, etc.) and longer pieces (books, plays, graphic novels, etc.). Care is taken to select readings that represent a broad range of genres, subjects, schools of thought, written by folks of varying backgrounds. We have a list of possible books, articles, etc., to read--please add to it here or PM your friendly neighborhood moderator with suggestions!

RSVP's for individual book meetup events will be closed at 25 to make sure they stay small enough that everyone who wishes to has a chance to speak. We have strictly social meetups (no reading, just chatting and often booze) about once a month, and occasionally we meetup for other relevant events (talks, movies, etc.). Ideas for movies/plays/happy hour spots/ etc. are welcome! Members are also encouraged to host events that interest them. Ping me for details! 

Dues are $5/year and can be paid through meetup, or directly to your friendly neighborhood mod (Hope) in person or through Venmo (@HopeRosalind). Dues go to paying meetup.com the fees to run the group. 

Members are invited to join our facebook group for discussion of all things feminist. <p> Shout-out to the San Diego Feminist Book Group who inspired the group!

name: Raising children without gender stereotyping
description: Calling all parents/caretakers who are interested in raising their children as free from gender stereotyping as possible. We will get together to share research studies, books, and personal experiences that prove the benefits of this style of parenting. You will meet like-minded parents/caretakers and get an intellectual and emotional boost to do the parenting that matters to you. You will also be part of a growing parenting movement.

name: LIMINAL
description:
LIMINAL is a feminist writing space located in Oakland. We host writing workshops & events of all kinds. All types of writers are welcome. Feminism is self-defined and individual. We believe in promoting each other, making money off of your art and using writing as a way to have a voice. www.theliminalcenter.com 

www.facebook.com/theliminalcenter.

name: Tech Workers Coalition
description: We are a coalition of workers in and around the tech industry, labor organizers, community organizers, and friends. Find out more at https://techworkerscoalition.org.

name: Oakland Feminist Book Club
description: Let's get together and discuss great books that touch on feminist issues. Books will take place in the United States and abroad and cover a range of human experiences. Everyone is welcome (you don't have to self-describe as a feminist). Come enjoy tea/wine/snacks and conversation with us!

name: Womanist Film Night
description:
A recurring womanist film night put on by Womanist Trilliance, an Oakland-based womanist org. Great films, great discussion, and a bit of respite to heal up and enjoy the transformative power of art together.

Also:
womanist trivia nights!
art openings!
potlucks!
and more!

Do join us!

name: Reproductive Justice Reading Group
description: We are a reading group dedicated to understanding how our culture oppresses women by controlling their reproductive lives. Issues to be discussed include access to sex education, contraception and abortion, as well as reproductive healthcare, parental leave, and affordable childcare. We will also discuss social pressures to have or not have children, silence around abortion, miscarriage and infertility, and pressures upon women to engage in ever-more "intensive mothering." We will explore these issues from a variety of perspectives, acknowledging that that they impact women of different racial identities, classes, and sexual identities in different ways. We also acknowledge that different groups of women have vastly different histories of experiencing reproductive oppression.

name: San Jose Political Activism Meetup
description: People that are interested in holding our elected leaders accountable, upholding our constitution, improving civil rights for everyone, and eschewing various forms of discrimination, including, but not limited to racism, xenophobia, sexism, misogyny, homophobia, and bigotry. People that are socially liberal (civil rights, common sense regulation, abortion rights, marriage equality), fiscally conservative (reduced spending and national debt, balanced budget, limited government), and believe in American exceptionalism (democratic principles, free but fair trade, legal immigration, and a land of laws).

name: RTS Sexual Violence Prevention and Survivor Support
description:
Rape Trauma Services of San Mateo County strives to eliminate all forms of violence, with a special focus on sexual assault and abuse. Informed by our understanding of traumatic experiences and cycles of violence, we facilitate healing and the prevention of violence through the provision of counseling, advocacy, and education. We promote and adopt policies, practices, and the social values rooted in fairness, equity and inclusiveness.
Learn more about us at www.rapetraumaservices.org

We invite anyone in the community interested in learning, sharing and/or taking an active role in preventing sexual violence and supporting people who have been affected by sexual violence to join our group.

name: Peninsula Feminist Book Club
description:
Hello Feminists,

Everyone who is interested in learning about, talking about and/or meeting people who care about feminism and gender equity is welcome. 

We recognize that each of us will have a different perspective to add to discussions. No one person's opinion or perspective is the "right" one. We recognize that hearing different perspectives will add to our own pool of knowledge.

The books we read are resources. We also talk about other subjects related to feminism and gender equity.

This is also a place where you can share your radical ideas. When a member wants to share an idea or observation that feels vulnerable to share,  that member can ask beforehand to be listened to only. Other members then will not share their different opinions at that time and instead be a witness to the courage of that member.

name: Innovate-Hers Women Business Leaders
description: From VC backed pitch events to fun podcasting and networking events, this group holds regular meetings in collaboration with the City of Berkeley, the Berkeley Chamber of Commerce, and other community organizations. We hope to make all women business leaders stronger, more confident, and more successful. The Office: Berkeley is inviting women business owners and aspiring entrepreneurs in the East Bay to get together and make great things happen!

name: AUMA
description:
<br>

AUMA stands for the Adult Use Marijuana Act that was passed in 2016. Which is great milestone for the 420 friends, community and cannabis culture in general.However, there are skeptics of the equability of the cannabis industry. The economics of marijuana include the billions of tax revenue dollars that will pour into California. As marijuana advocates continue to push for reform Sacramento's underrepresented communities struggle to rebuild and anticipate the fate of gentrification. Economic and social justice is an inclusive concept. Many people of color strive to be heard. <br>

Currently, I am working on a film about drug war reparations as they pertain to the cannabis industry. The purpose is to open a dialogue about the upcoming for-profit cannabis industry in 2018. In addition, the documentary will propose shared cannabis equity with underrepresented communities; specifically African American women. I also want to reach out to African American women that would like to share their personal experiences and perspectives on film. All feminist are welcome to join and share your feminist voice on this matter. There will be upcoming sister circle discussions, guest speakers that include activist, educators, and community leaders. I look forward to connecting with you in creating and filming this movement.

#blackgirlmagic

#afrofeminist Much Love <br>

name: Art and Activism Santa Rosa
description:
Are you an artist? writer? performer? Have you ever felt frustrated? Felt that you have no voice and few people in your current community who share your values?
This Meet-up is for all creatives, thinkers, performers, and makers who concerned with social equality, feminism, politics, and equal rights.
Totally open to anyone who wishes to have informed, provocative, inspiring monthly discussions on whats to come, the challenges we face, and how to communicate our solutions artistically.
Particularly interested in any makers who would like to collaborate on a public group exhibition/event in fall 2018.

name: Women's March Sacramento
description:
We welcome women and their allies to build a strong community in the greater Sacramento region who stand for gender equity, social justice and equal rights for all.

This meet up will focus on further engagement with the community and activities in the lead-up to the march, including discussion, sign-making parties, flyer posting parties and fundraising activities.

In 2017 we marched and made our voices heard. This year we expand our work to engage youth, uplift women leaders, advocate for gender equity and stand together against voter suppression and for fair protection of all human rights.

Visit Women's March Sacramento Website for more event details
https://womensmarchsac.com/

name: Power to Empower your Feminine Power
description:
POWER TO EMPOWER YOUR FEMININE POWER

WHERE EVERY WOMAN IS CELEBRATED AS HERSELF!

Ladies lets inspire, empower and encourage one another!

If you are a woman yearning to give voice to your deeper truth, discover and express your spiritual gifts, commune with nature and awaken your feminine power, I invite you to join me. When women come together, magic happens. Together we will stretch toward our highest possibilities. We will create a powerful bond as we celebrate and honor each other, and those that came before us. Lets shine our lights and thrive together. Wherever you are is perfect. No prerequisites necessary, just a willingness to support and be supported. ENJOY CONNECTION IN NATURE AMONG THE BEAUTIFUL REDWOOD TREES. 2nd Wednesday of the month starting March 14 @ 11:00 - 12:30 HOSTED BY Rev. Catherine Alana Frosi 


I have been committed and dedicated to raising the consciousness of all inhabitants on planet earth as a Planetary Healer for 30 years. I'm an energy worker with certifications & training in Feminine Power, Hawaiian Shamanic Practitioner, Clinical Hypno-Therapy, Reiki, Minister, Goddess Rituals, Akashic Record Practitioner & Angelic Card Reader. I work with God/Spirit/Universe the Source of all that there is, Arch Angels, Ascended Masters, spirit guides, crystals, and sound!

name: Financial Feminists
description: We are a group of activists who convene regularly to inspire one another, share information, and strategically address gender-based inequality in the financial (banking, lending, investment, insurance, etc.) industry.

name: The Matriarchy Meetup
description: The Matriarchy is coming! We talk so much about fighting the patriarchy, but let's plan for a viable replacement. This meet up group will highlight work by feminist activists across disciplines with presentations, discussions and time to connect in a safe, inclusive, intersectional space for femme-identifying people.

name: Guys We F***** Podcast Discussion/ Meet Up
description: For women of any age to discuss the podcast Guys We F***** over wine and snacks! Somewhere to meet new people and talk about interesting topics directly effecting women. Discussions will revolve around the podcast that was released the Friday prior to the meet up.

name: Exploring Intimacy LGBTQ
description:
There is a strong current of energy that circulates internally and magnifies within a space of women who are unapologetically living from the core of their being. We amplify each other when we feel safe to express ourselves through our heart, our soul, our dance. We give ourselves and each other an allowance of beauty to just be. There is no room for self doubt here. We know true power when we thrive in unity and connection. It's in this sacred space, we get free.

Introducing Exploring Intimacy LGBTQ, a community to bring out and reveal who you are, who you really are.
Drop in and call forth your vulnerable essence, your powerful creative genius, your fierce beast, your inner sensual Goddess self! Connect and nurture your femininity and bring her out. All parts of you are welcome here

WELCOME TO EXPLORING INTIMACY

A community to connect us to our common humanity through love.

A safe space for those to share their stories about their journey and emotional investment towards deeper intimacy.

A gathering of ideas to embrace the idea of love, intimacy, and connection as a transformative force.

Perhaps, we want to take out the "hopeless" and be real, honest, and raw about our inner romantic. Perhaps, we want to admit our cynic, our pain, our struggle, as we cope to understand how to be true to love (again). Here we can, embrace the down's, the up's, the contraction, the expansion The woes and the glows.

Participate as much as you want. You are welcome here.

THIS IS FOR

For those who want to explore a deeper fulfilling connection beyond small talk. 

For those who want to explore sexuality and consciousness in a safe space 
For those who want to explore and learn ways to heighten all your senses 
For those who want to explore vulnerability and authentic relating

name: Reproductive Justice Reading Group
description: We are a reading group dedicated to understanding how our culture oppresses women by controlling their reproductive lives. Issues to be discussed include access to sex education, contraception and abortion, as well as reproductive healthcare, parental leave, and affordable childcare. We will also discuss social pressures to have or not have children, silence around abortion, miscarriage and infertility, and pressures upon women to engage in ever-more "intensive mothering." We will explore these issues from a variety of perspectives, acknowledging that that they impact women of different racial identities, classes, and sexual identities in different ways. We also acknowledge that different groups of women have vastly different histories of experiencing reproductive oppression.

name: Art and Activism Santa Rosa
description:
Are you an artist? writer? performer? Have you ever felt frustrated? Felt that you have no voice and few people in your current community who share your values?
This Meet-up is for all creatives, thinkers, performers, and makers who concerned with social equality, feminism, politics, and equal rights.
Totally open to anyone who wishes to have informed, provocative, inspiring monthly discussions on whats to come, the challenges we face, and how to communicate our solutions artistically.
Particularly interested in any makers who would like to collaborate on a public group exhibition/event in fall 2018.

name: Financial Feminists
description: We are a group of activists who convene regularly to inspire one another, share information, and strategically address gender-based inequality in the financial (banking, lending, investment, insurance, etc.) industry.

name: The Matriarchy Meetup
description: The Matriarchy is coming! We talk so much about fighting the patriarchy, but let's plan for a viable replacement. This meet up group will highlight work by feminist activists across disciplines with presentations, discussions and time to connect in a safe, inclusive, intersectional space for femme-identifying people.

name: Financial Feminists
description: We are a group of activists who convene regularly to inspire one another, share information, and strategically address gender-based inequality in the financial (banking, lending, investment, insurance, etc.) industry.

name: Black Feminist Book Club
description:
Reading a book is fun, but following it up with an awesome in-depth discussion and sharing of ideas and opinions (preferably over snacks and tea) is *even more* fun. We'll be covering it all, from dismantling the master's house with Audre Lorde to exploring Afrofuturism and black women in sci-fi/fantasy with Octavia Butler and Nnedi Okorafor to dissecting the works of Wangechi Mutu and Kara Walker, and everything in between, to the left and the right, above and below. This group is for black readers who seek and want to connect with other equally dope black readers. All ages and genders welcome.

Follow us on instagram! @blackfeministbookclub

name: Womanist Film Night
description:
A recurring womanist film night put on by Womanist Trilliance, an Oakland-based womanist org. Great films, great discussion, and a bit of respite to heal up and enjoy the transformative power of art together.

Also:
womanist trivia nights!
art openings!
potlucks!
and more!

Do join us!

name: Financial Feminists
description: We are a group of activists who convene regularly to inspire one another, share information, and strategically address gender-based inequality in the financial (banking, lending, investment, insurance, etc.) industry.

name: The Matriarchy Meetup
description: The Matriarchy is coming! We talk so much about fighting the patriarchy, but let's plan for a viable replacement. This meet up group will highlight work by feminist activists across disciplines with presentations, discussions and time to connect in a safe, inclusive, intersectional space for femme-identifying people.

name: Ethical Culture Society of Silicon Valley
description:
We are a democratic fellowship for people seeking a rational, compassionate philosophy of life without regard to belief or non belief in a supreme being.  We value the importance of living ethical, responsible, and socially connected lives.

Together, we do service projects that benefit the larger community, including cleaning up the Bay, food sorting, collecting items for the homeless, and helping disadvantaged families.

We welcome people from a variety of religious backgrounds.  Some consider themselves humanists, atheists, or agnostics. Our emphasis is on what we DO to make the world a better place individually and together.

We discuss ethical dilemmas that arise in our lives, hold programs to learn about ourselves, each other, and the issues of the day. We seek to be fully engaged in the community and the world.

If you seek social events, social action and a socially-minded community, share your passion and join us!

For more information, visit our website at:  ecssv.org

name: NetSquared Silicon Valley
description:
NetSquared gathers together nonprofits and activists, tech leaders and funders, and everyone who's interested in using technology for social change.

NONPROFIT STAFF will find a friendly, welcoming atmosphere for those who aren't experienced with technology, and many chances to ask questions of tech-experienced nonprofits and experts.
