(Duration: 1hr) - 5 min platform (may be shorter); completely voluntary - Receive thoughtful feedback - Enjoy yummy snacks - Close with positive affirmations. *Duration may vary depending on attendance

This is a very casual meet-up with no pressure to be in the spotlight. The flow is organic and welcoming so smile, tie your hair up and chat about the ebbs and flows of life with us and hopefully you take with you that ONE thing you needed to hear, that ONE resource/connection you needed or at the very least, feel spiritually lighter! All ages welcome. Meeting locations vary.

name: Women's Sexual Empowerment Education Group
description: This is a one time invitation for women who are interested in enhancing their loving relationship with themselves so that they might better love others or feel more connected to their life. We will watch a movie about the world renowned Betty Dodson, sex educator, and how she has helped women increase their sexual potential for pleasure for 45 years. There will be a Q and A afterward. Popcorn and non-alcoholic beverages will be served. 5- 10 dollar donation.

name: Bay Area Women's Bible Study
description: This is a group of young women (18-25 years old) for those who have a heart to seek God, want to develop spiritual senses, and serious about life of faith. We do fellowship and bible study. It's a wonderful group for those who want to build up their relationship with God and improve their life.

name: Women's Drum Circle at herchurch
description: This is drumming circle for women at herchurch. Join Drumming Priestess Mz. Dionne, a life-long drummer and drum teacher, in an evening of drumming in circle. Some drums are provided, though bring one if you have one. No experience necessary.

name: Lotus Collective
description: "Women, with all our complexities and versions, we need each other...for the love all good things, no more "I wish I were her" manifestations, affirmations, incantations, chants...it's f-ing up your Chi and messing up your potential badass friend crew"

name: Women's Collective
description: "Women, with all our complexities and versions, we need each other...for the love all good things, no more "I wish I were her" manifestations, affirmations, incantations, chants...it's f-ing up your Chi and messing up your potential badass friend crew"

name: Start With Yourself Meetup
description: This is a group for anyone interested in building community, trying new things and creating a legacy you can feel great about. We do all different kinds of activities together ranging from cleaning up a beach to going on a bike ride, to trying a new fitness class... This group is great for people who are interested in good conversation about how to make a difference in the world by starting with oneself. We are health and fitness providers and love organizing groups to try new things and be out in the world with the living!

name: Womens Communication And Relationship Skills
description: Women looking for a totally unique group! Let horses, yes horses, be your teachers in mastering leadership and communication skills. No riding and no experience with horses needed. Experiential learning format. Equine assisted learning helps you discover your authentic self. Horses act as mirrors to your soul.

name: Women Rise Up Santa Cruz
description:
Hello Gorgeous Women
Welcome to Women Rise Up!

Where you can give and receive support in a variety of ways. 
(This is a new group that is still evolving, be sure to attend so your voice and presence can be heard and felt)  

This is a place where you get to practice being authentic, true to yourself and present with yourself and your needs. A space where you get to exercise your receiving muscle and stand in your value. An opportunity where you can connect and network with big-hearted, passionate women who have big gifts, a large vision and a common intent to share an shine! 

AND, we as WOMEN, with big things to do in the world, THRIVE with support, boundaries, clear communication, awesome self-care, and an empowering practice that LOVINGLY supports the mind and body to be in alignment with our mission and vision without shaming, judging, and criticizing (which shuts us down and keeps us from forward motion).  

TOGETHER we are stronger!

Most importantly, as a women, we have feelings and emotions...and often our businesses become a place where our greatest healing takes place. 

How do we stay positive and make progress in our business when we are busy processing, feeling and healing?

How do we learn how to know what we want and ASK for it if we don't have a safe place to practice? 

Come be seen, heard and supported, and bring friends that you feel are in alignment to this group.

In gratitude and service, Carla

name: Empowered Mamas Creating Legacies
description:
Moms who are ready to reclaim their personal power! Those ready to release their "shoulds!" Those who should take back control of their life to create their legacy! Those ready to be the best example to their children! Those who are ready to stop sitting on the sidelines of life!


You can also join our private Facebook group! https://www.facebook.com/groups/mamascreatinglegacies

name: San Francisco Women's Empowerment Meetup
description: Hosting events where women role models in career, finance, sprituality, self care, athletics, and wellbeing speak to their experiences. Facilitated group conversation follows. Women find inspiration, support and a nudge towards their dreams.

name: Radical Health, Wealth and Life Fulfillment!
description: This is a group for anyone interested in personal growth, extraordinary health and wealth, awesome relationships and life fulfillment on your terms. All people are welcome. I started this group to meet other people who are enthusiastic about living their best life. Looking forward to growing, learning, sharing and expanding with you!

name: Woodland/Davis Self-Empowerment Meetup
description: We offer practical, empowering tools for transformation. Through meetings and some writing and reading exercises in between, the group will deepen, offering the perfect safe, authentic container for personal empowerment. Conscious communication, deepening our relationship to self and others and exploring our barriers and blocks to claiming our full expression of empowerment will be explored.

name: Yoni Egg and Women's Empowerment
description: This is a group for anyone interested in Yoni Egg, Toists pelvic exercises and history, and women's body / mind empowerment.

name: Power to Empower your Feminine Power
description:
POWER TO EMPOWER YOUR FEMININE POWER

WHERE EVERY WOMAN IS CELEBRATED AS HERSELF!

Ladies lets inspire, empower and encourage one another!

If you are a woman yearning to give voice to your deeper truth, discover and express your spiritual gifts, commune with nature and awaken your feminine power, I invite you to join me. When women come together, magic happens. Together we will stretch toward our highest possibilities. We will create a powerful bond as we celebrate and honor each other, and those that came before us. Lets shine our lights and thrive together. Wherever you are is perfect. No prerequisites necessary, just a willingness to support and be supported. ENJOY CONNECTION IN NATURE AMONG THE BEAUTIFUL REDWOOD TREES. 2nd Wednesday of the month starting March 14 @ 11:00 - 12:30 HOSTED BY Rev. Catherine Alana Frosi 


I have been committed and dedicated to raising the consciousness of all inhabitants on planet earth as a Planetary Healer for 30 years. I'm an energy worker with certifications & training in Feminine Power, Hawaiian Shamanic Practitioner, Clinical Hypno-Therapy, Reiki, Minister, Goddess Rituals, Akashic Record Practitioner & Angelic Card Reader. I work with God/Spirit/Universe the Source of all that there is, Arch Angels, Ascended Masters, spirit guides, crystals, and sound!

name: Bay Area Women of Color Personal Growth Group
description: This is a group for anyone who identifies as a woman of color and is interested in exploring issues of personal growth, personal development, empowerment, self-actualization, and generally making life more enjoyable. We will meet in informal settings (coffee shops, cafes, wine bars, etc.) to connect and learn together. There will also be personal growth retreats and event opportunities shared from time to time. I look forward to meeting other women of color who are searching for a place where they can connect, learn and grow!

name: Solano County Sister Circle of Empowerment Meetup
description:
Hello Lovelies...Solano County finally has a sister circle of empowerment willing and ready to empower, enlighten, and energize you.

We're positive, we're open, we're engaging and lively.

Our group is designed to provide a safe place for you to voice your opinion, ask questions that will benefit you (personally and professionally) and learn best practices from one another.

You'll be encouraged; you'll discover your authenticity, you'll be challenged, and you'll be inspired...you may even laugh...cause sometimes life is funny! ;-)

You'll have a support system that you can tap into "who get you" and still think you're marvelous!

Each month we'll focus on a different topic, complete with interaction, participation, and q&a.

We'll meet once per month initially:
In Person: 2nd Thursday - 6-7pm PT Location TBD (will rotate based on #members)
Via Online - members will be provided sign in info

name: Bay Area Conscious Feminine Entrepreneurs
description: We are powerful women on a mission to share our gifts in the most authentic way and create lasting change and increase consciousness. Creating, managing and running your own business can be daunting and time consuming, not to mention lonely and often overwhelming. This group was created to help educate, engage and surround each of us with like- minded and inspired feminine energy and expertise. We have bold entrepreneurs looking to share their gifts and help you grow. This is a community of empowered, driven women looking to grow your business, feed your mind and create lasting relationships of support and community.

name: San Francisco Women's Social Network (30's/40's)
description: This is a group for women in their 30's and 40's looking to expand their social network and enjoy a variety of activities, such as happy hours, dinners out, brunch, hikes, day trips, and travel.

name: Women Rise Up Santa Cruz
description:
Hello Gorgeous Women
Welcome to Women Rise Up!

Where you can give and receive support in a variety of ways. 
(This is a new group that is still evolving, be sure to attend so your voice and presence can be heard and felt)  

This is a place where you get to practice being authentic, true to yourself and present with yourself and your needs. A space where you get to exercise your receiving muscle and stand in your value. An opportunity where you can connect and network with big-hearted, passionate women who have big gifts, a large vision and a common intent to share an shine! 

AND, we as WOMEN, with big things to do in the world, THRIVE with support, boundaries, clear communication, awesome self-care, and an empowering practice that LOVINGLY supports the mind and body to be in alignment with our mission and vision without shaming, judging, and criticizing (which shuts us down and keeps us from forward motion).  

TOGETHER we are stronger!

Most importantly, as a women, we have feelings and emotions...and often our businesses become a place where our greatest healing takes place. 

How do we stay positive and make progress in our business when we are busy processing, feeling and healing?

How do we learn how to know what we want and ASK for it if we don't have a safe place to practice? 

Come be seen, heard and supported, and bring friends that you feel are in alignment to this group.

In gratitude and service, Carla

name: Polka Dot Powerhouse Palo Alto Chapter
description: First, it's important to note that we are not a networking group with attendance and referral requirements! We are a connections organization! I truly believe that when women connect and genuinely get to know each other that then they want to help each other whether it is personal development or their business. This group has improved not only my life but so many of us because we surround ourselves with positivity! We officially launched the Palo Alto/Los Altos chapter back in March and after just a few short months we are now over 60 members strong in this chapter and meeting twice a month! Currently we meet at Breathe Holistic Health center (a members space) from 11:30am-1:30pm 2x a month. Registration is required and last minute cancellations heavily frowned upon. CLICK HERE to learn more and register -->https://www.polkadotpowerhouse.com/link-to-chapters/129-palo-alto-ca More about us: Drama Free, Respectful, Inspiring, Successful women,.. we may or may not work for ourselves, or well known companies, or coach, train, advise, organize, educate... we have published authors, well known speakers, and top sellers in their respective companies within our nationwide organization and right here in Silicon Valley. We don't judge you, come as you are, be amazed that something like this exists! And the best part is we are growing SO FAST! we now have established chapters in Fremont, San Jose, San Mateo, Half Moon Bay, SF, Sonoma, Fresno, Visalia, Reno and all over the country. It is a very exciting time to be a woman!

name: Foster & Flourish Circles for Women
description:
Monthly gathering of women. A different special guest each month shares something she's passionate about.  

These circles are organized by Yoga and Meditation teacher Tina Foster and are held in her Mission District studio. 

These circles are safe, conscious and co-creative. The vibe is relaxed and casual. The intention is to gather women to share, celebrate, inspire and support one a other in an organic, evolving community setting.

Via Online - members will be provided sign in info

name: Folsom Real Women-Brave Stories
description: This is a group designed to empower women to sit down, get real, and share vulnerable stories about real life struggles, marriage, fears, and insecurity, while learning the power of owning their authentic story. Dress comfortably, bring a mug, and be prepared to embrace your authentic self. We grow through community and learning how to lean in to our vulnerabilities.

name: Folsom Real Women-Brave Stories
description: This is a group designed to empower women to sit down, get real, and share vulnerable stories about real life struggles, marriage, fears, and insecurity, while learning the power of owning their authentic story. Dress comfortably, bring a mug, and be prepared to embrace your authentic self. We grow through community and learning how to lean in to our vulnerabilities.

name: Embodied Feminine Wisdom
description: This is a group for women interested in exploring, knowing, reinventing, and expressing themselves through the movement, art, ritual, and myth. Come play in the realm of Embodied Feminine Wisdom Archetypes including The Maiden, The Lover, The Amazon Warrior Woman, The Child, The Mother, The Virgin, The Priestess and more! Each month explores a different archetypal realm and guides you gently into a deeper discovery of self and playful expressions held in a warm and inviting container. Come play and come to know yourself more fully, more wisely!

name: San Francisco Financial Literacy Group
description: This group is for anyone interested in learning more about how money and investing works. From basic financial concepts to understanding various retirement saving, college saving, investments and insurance products. We focus on financial education, concepts not typically taught in schools. Concepts useful to the general population (the 99%) regardless of economic status.

name: Sac Feminists
description:
Feminists come here to connect, find safe space, educate themselves, and educate each other on feminist issues.

We put on unique events for members of Sac Feminists, and we also cross-post events from other local progressive organizations so that members can see a lot of opportunities to get involved and connect.

If you have an idea for a meetup, get in touch with the organizers.

(In order to be approved as a member, you must answer the profile questions and have a picture of your face in your profile.)

name: Association for India's Development Bay Area Chapter
description:
We are a group of people compassionate about the problems and issues that many of the underprivileged people in India face everyday and we believe that with our help they can overcome the problems. We support grassroots non-profits in India in all spheres including education, environment, agriculture, women's rights as we believe that all these problems are interconnected and they need to be addressed holistically. Join us if you share the same belief and want to contribute some of your personal time towards this.

Association for India's Development is the organization we are part of which has close to 40 chapters across USA. Visit http://www.aidindia.org to know more about AID and http://bayarea.aidindia.org to know more about the Bay Area Chapter.

name: East Bay Feminist Book Club
description:
The East Bay Feminist Book Club is a social group open to all people who want to expand their knowledge about feminism and women's rights issues. We will read from a variety of feminist camps and persectives, including 2nd wave, 3rd wave, Black feminism, lesbian feminism, trans* perspectives, riot grrrl movement, third world feminism, etc. We'll also read things that aren't directly about feminism, but are interesting to read and discuss from a feminist lens. 

Our meetings are a space for open and respectful discussions of different viewpoints. Sometimes discussions stay strictly on the texts; other times, readings lend themselves to more personal discussions. Please check out our Discussion-Guideline-in-progress before attending meetings, and feel free offer suggestions and critiques. 

On readings: we tend to alternate between shorter readings (articles, short stories, essays, etc.) and longer pieces (books, plays, graphic novels, etc.). Care is taken to select readings that represent a broad range of genres, subjects, schools of thought, written by folks of varying backgrounds. We have a list of possible books, articles, etc., to read--please add to it here or PM your friendly neighborhood moderator with suggestions!

RSVP's for individual book meetup events will be closed at 25 to make sure they stay small enough that everyone who wishes to has a chance to speak. We have strictly social meetups (no reading, just chatting and often booze) about once a month, and occasionally we meetup for other relevant events (talks, movies, etc.). Ideas for movies/plays/happy hour spots/ etc. are welcome! Members are also encouraged to host events that interest them. Ping me for details! 

Dues are $5/year and can be paid through meetup, or directly to your friendly neighborhood mod (Hope) in person or through Venmo (@HopeRosalind). Dues go to paying meetup.com the fees to run the group. 

Members are invited to join our facebook group for discussion of all things feminist. <p> Shout-out to the San Diego Feminist Book Group who inspired the group!

name: International Socialist Organization of SF
description:
Join our group that meets in person every Wednesday night. We are a group of Marxists organizing for a better world. We debate, we study, we protest. #blacklivesmatter #freepalestine #wearethe99% #EqualRights also check out: socialistworker.org isreview.org norcalsocialism.org haymarketbooks.org

[NOTE: you are welcome to RSVP to our events here, but that's optional; you can always just show up. Note that meet-up.com RSVPs do not reflect real attendance. Most meetings have between 15-30 participants or more!] <br>

name: Amer Assoc of University Women (AAUW) - Sunnyvale/Cupertino
description:
AAUW, American Association of University Women, is an organization that promotes education, philanthropy and equity for all women and girls.

AAUW gives scholarships to local middle school girls who are interested in math and science. Members will share information about other various AAUW programs such as post-graduate scholarships/fellowships, national legal advocacy, public policy for women, and other fun activities such as book, bridge, lunch and dinner groups plus more.

We have a variety of programs to address the interests of the AAUW community and the public is welcome to all events.

For further information contact Peggy Maibaum, Peggyapcm@gmail.com or 408-358-2913.

name: Reproductive Justice Reading Group
description: We are a reading group dedicated to understanding how our culture oppresses women by controlling their reproductive lives. Issues to be discussed include access to sex education, contraception and abortion, as well as reproductive healthcare, parental leave, and affordable childcare. We will also discuss social pressures to have or not have children, silence around abortion, miscarriage and infertility, and pressures upon women to engage in ever-more "intensive mothering." We will explore these issues from a variety of perspectives, acknowledging that that they impact women of different racial identities, classes, and sexual identities in different ways. We also acknowledge that different groups of women have vastly different histories of experiencing reproductive oppression.

name: #Resist: Salinas
description:
Concerned about where the country is heading? You're not alone. Join others who care about what's happening to democracy, equality, human rights, social justice, sustainability, and other important topics. It's ok if you've never been to a protest, march, or town hall -- start here. You really can make a difference.

WHAT YOU CAN DO
- Join this group now
- Schedule one of our Meetup ideas in your neighborhood
- Discuss your own Meetup ideas in the group conversation

OUR COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
- Be Peaceful
- Be Safe
- Be Kind
- Be Respectful
- Be Real

name: RTS Sexual Violence Prevention and Survivor Support
description:
Rape Trauma Services of San Mateo County strives to eliminate all forms of violence, with a special focus on sexual assault and abuse. Informed by our understanding of traumatic experiences and cycles of violence, we facilitate healing and the prevention of violence through the provision of counseling, advocacy, and education. We promote and adopt policies, practices, and the social values rooted in fairness, equity and inclusiveness.
Learn more about us at www.rapetraumaservices.org

We invite anyone in the community interested in learning, sharing and/or taking an active role in preventing sexual violence and supporting people who have been affected by sexual violence to join our group.

name: The Pink Hat Resistance
description:
The Pink Hat Resistance is a Women's March inspired women's political action and empowerment group. We have monthly meetings on the third Monday of every month at 6:00 PM on the Stanford campus. Currently composed of women in the Stanford staff community, I'd like to open membership up to other women in the community.
For those who cannot attend the meetings, you can still sign up for our weekly newsletter and participate on group projects. Our newsletter has updates on club activities, summaries of the meetings, the meeting packets (with lots of great info and tips), info on Bay area protests and rallies, links to fascinating news & opinion articles I recommend, and some good new items to celebrate!
We also have a secret Facebook group where we post relevant articles for discussion.
You can check out our website at: www.thepinkhatresistance.com

name: About Face, Sac; Prev: Iraq Vets Againts The War & Ruckus
description:
New Active Social Peaceful Protest Group of Like Minds, Sacramento Action Activist Group of Veterans & Civilians Againts the Military/Industrial Complex; Against Trump, Against GOP Extremist, Against White Supremacists, Against Russia Influence, and Against Corporate Government Control & Greed, Against Racial, Religion, Gender, & LGBTIQ Discrimination.

In support of Equal Human Rights (racial, LGBTIQ: all genders, orientation, identity, non gender binary, and marriage equality), Affordable Medical Coverage for all, Free Education, Global Warming is Real, supporting groups such as Love is Love, BLM Sac, Sac Democrats, Ruckus Society, Iraq Vets Against the War, & Together We Rise Sac! We support peaceful marches and demonstrations, with the goal of deconstructing the giant Pharmaceutical, and War Industrial Corporate Complex!

name: Art and Activism Santa Rosa
description:
Are you an artist? writer? performer? Have you ever felt frustrated? Felt that you have no voice and few people in your current community who share your values?
This Meet-up is for all creatives, thinkers, performers, and makers who concerned with social equality, feminism, politics, and equal rights.
Totally open to anyone who wishes to have informed, provocative, inspiring monthly discussions on whats to come, the challenges we face, and how to communicate our solutions artistically.
Particularly interested in any makers who would like to collaborate on a public group exhibition/event in fall 2018.

name: Women's March Sacramento
description:
We welcome women and their allies to build a strong community in the greater Sacramento region who stand for gender equity, social justice and equal rights for all.

This meet up will focus on further engagement with the community and activities in the lead-up to the march, including discussion, sign-making parties, flyer posting parties and fundraising activities.

In 2017 we marched and made our voices heard. This year we expand our work to engage youth, uplift women leaders, advocate for gender equity and stand together against voter suppression and for fair protection of all human rights.

Visit Women's March Sacramento Website for more event details
https://womensmarchsac.com/

name: Financial Feminists
description: We are a group of activists who convene regularly to inspire one another, share information, and strategically address gender-based inequality in the financial (banking, lending, investment, insurance, etc.) industry.

name: The Matriarchy Meetup
description: The Matriarchy is coming! We talk so much about fighting the patriarchy, but let's plan for a viable replacement. This meet up group will highlight work by feminist activists across disciplines with presentations, discussions and time to connect in a safe, inclusive, intersectional space for femme-identifying people.

description:

name: LIMINAL
description:
LIMINAL is a feminist writing space located in Oakland. We host writing workshops & events of all kinds. All types of writers are welcome. Feminism is self-defined and individual. We believe in promoting each other, making money off of your art and using writing as a way to have a voice. www.theliminalcenter.com 

www.facebook.com/theliminalcenter.

name: Reproductive Justice Reading Group
description: We are a reading group dedicated to understanding how our culture oppresses women by controlling their reproductive lives. Issues to be discussed include access to sex education, contraception and abortion, as well as reproductive healthcare, parental leave, and affordable childcare. We will also discuss social pressures to have or not have children, silence around abortion, miscarriage and infertility, and pressures upon women to engage in ever-more "intensive mothering." We will explore these issues from a variety of perspectives, acknowledging that that they impact women of different racial identities, classes, and sexual identities in different ways. We also acknowledge that different groups of women have vastly different histories of experiencing reproductive oppression.
